list.doc: In the country Afghanistan in Asia with the Kabul are the following languages spoken: Dari Persian, Pashtu (both official), other Turkic and minor languages.
In the country Albania in Europe with the Tirana are the following languages spoken: Albanian (Tosk is the official dialect), Greek.
In the country Algeria in Africa with the Algiers are the following languages spoken: Arabic (official), French, Berber dialects.
In the country Andorra in Europe with the Andorra la Vella are the following languages spoken: Catal√°n (official), French, Castilian, Portuguese.
In the country Angola in Africa with the Luanda are the following languages spoken: Portuguese (official), Bantu and other African languages.
In the country Antigua and Barbuda in North and Central America (Including the Caribbean) with the Saint John"s are the following languages spoken: English (official), local dialects.
In the country Argentina in South America with the Buenos Aires are the following languages spoken: Spanish (official), English, Italian, German, French.
In the country Armenia in Asia with the Yerevan are the following languages spoken: Armenian 98%, Yezidi, Russian.
In the country Australia in Oceania/Australia with the Canberra are the following languages spoken: English 79%, native and other languages.
In the country Austria in Europe with the Vienna are the following languages spoken: German (official nationwide); Slovene, Croatian, Hungarian (each official in one region).
In the country Azerbaijan in Asia with the Baku are the following languages spoken: Azerbaijani Turkic 89%, Russian 3%, Armenian 2%, other 6% (1995 est.).
In the country Bahamas in North and Central America (Including the Caribbean) with the The Nassau are the following languages spoken: English (official), Creole (among Haitian immigrants).
In the country Bahrain in Asia with the Manama are the following languages spoken: Arabic, English, Farsi, Urdu.
In the country Bangladesh in Asia with the Dhaka are the following languages spoken: Bangla (official), English.
In the country Barbados in North and Central America (Including the Caribbean) with the Bridgetown are the following languages spoken: English.
In the country Belarus in Europe with the Minsk are the following languages spoken: Belorussian (White Russian), Russian, other.
In the country Belgium in Europe with the Brussels are the following languages spoken: Dutch (Flemish) 60%, French 40%, German less than 1% (all official).
In the country Belize in North and Central America (Including the Caribbean) with the Belmopan are the following languages spoken: English (official), Spanish, Mayan, Garifuna (Carib), Creole.
In the country Benin in Africa with the Porto-Novo are the following languages spoken: French (official), Fon, Yoruba, tribal languages.
In the country Bhutan in Asia with the Thimphu are the following languages spoken: Dzongkha (official), Tibetan dialects (among Bhotes), Nepalese dialects (among Nepalese).
In the country Bolivia in South America with the La Paz are the following languages spoken: Spanish, Quechua, Aymara (all official).
In the country Bosnia and Herzegovina in Europe with the Sarajevo are the following languages spoken: Bosnian, Croatian, Serbian.
In the country Botswana in Africa with the Gaborone are the following languages spoken: English 2% (official), Setswana 78%, Kalanga 8%, Sekgalagadi 3%, other (2001).
In the country Brazil in South America with the Brasilia are the following languages spoken: Portuguese (official), Spanish, English, French.
In the country Brunei in Asia with the Bandar Seri Begawan are the following languages spoken: Malay (official), English, Chinese.
In the country Bulgaria in Europe with the Sofia are the following languages spoken: Bulgarian 85%, Turkish 10%, Roma 4%.
In the country Burkina Faso in Africa with the Ouagadougou are the following languages spoken: French (official); native African (Sudanic) languages 90%.
In the country Burundi in Africa with the Bujumbura are the following languages spoken: Kirundi and French (official), Swahili.
In the country Cambodia in Asia with the Phnom Penh are the following languages spoken: Khmer 95% (official), French, English.
In the country Cameroon in Africa with the Yaounde are the following languages spoken: French, English (both official); 24 major African language groups.
In the country Canada in North and Central America (Including the Caribbean) with the Ottawa are the following languages spoken: English 59.3%, French 23.2% (both official); other 17.5%.
In the country Cape Verde in Africa with the Praia are the following languages spoken: Portuguese, Criuolo.
In the country Central African Republic in Africa with the Bangui are the following languages spoken: French (official), Sangho (lingua franca, national), tribal languages.
In the country Chad in Africa with the N"Djamena are the following languages spoken: French, Arabic (both official); Sara; more than 120 languages and dialects.
In the country Chile in South America with the Santiago are the following languages spoken: Spanish.

In the country China in Asia with the Beijing are the following languages spoken: Standard Chinese (Mandarin/Putonghua), Yue (Cantonese), Wu (Shanghaiese), Minbei (Fuzhou), Minnan (Hokkien-Taiwanese), Xiang, Gan, Hakka dialects, minority languages.
In the country Colombia in South America with the Bogota are the following languages spoken: Spanish.
In the country Comoros in Africa with the Moroni are the following languages spoken: Arabic and French (both official), Shikomoro (Swahili/Arabic blend).
In the country Congo in Africa with the Brazzaville are the following languages spoken: French (official), Lingala, Monokutuba, Kikongo, Tshiluba, many local languages and dialects.
In the country Costa Rica in North and Central America (Including the Caribbean) with the San Jose are the following languages spoken: Spanish (official), English.
In the country Cote d"Ivoire in Africa with the Yamoussoukro are the following languages spoken: French (official) and African languages (Dioula esp.).
In the country Croatia in Europe with the Zagreb are the following languages spoken: Croatian 96% (official), other 4% (including Italian, Hungarian, Czech, Slovak, German).
In the country Cuba in North and Central America (Including the Caribbean) with the Havana are the following languages spoken: Spanish.
In the country Cyprus in Europe with the Nicosia are the following languages spoken: Greek, Turkish (both official); English.
In the country Czech Republic in Europe with the Prague are the following languages spoken: Czech.
In the country Denmark in Europe with the Copenhagen are the following languages spoken: Danish, Faroese, Greenlandic (Inuit dialect), German; English is the predominant second language.
In the country Djibouti in Africa with the Djibouti are the following languages spoken: French and Arabic (both official), Somali, Afar.
In the country Dominica in North and Central America (Including the Caribbean) with the Roseau are the following languages spoken: English (official) and French patois.
In the country Dominican Republic in North and Central America (Including the Caribbean) with the Santo Domingo are the following languages spoken: Spanish.

In the country East Timor in Asia with the Dili are the following languages spoken: Tetum, Portuguese (official); Bahasa Indonesia, English; other indigenous languages, including Tetum, Galole, Mambae, and Kemak.
In the country Ecuador in South America with the Quito are the following languages spoken: Spanish (official), Quechua, other Amerindian languages.
In the country Egypt in Africa with the Cairo are the following languages spoken: Arabic (official), English and French widely understood by educated classes.
In the country El Salvador in South America with the San Salvador are the following languages spoken: Spanish, Nahua (among some Amerindians).
In the country Equatorial Guinea in Africa with the Malabo are the following languages spoken: Spanish, French (both official); pidgin English, Fang, Bubi, Ibo.
In the country Eritrea in Africa with the Asmara are the following languages spoken: Afar, Arabic, Tigre and Kunama, Tigrinya, other Cushitic languages.
In the country Estonia in Europe with the Tallinn are the following languages spoken: Estonian 67% (official), Russian 30%, other (2000).
In the country Ethiopia in Africa with the Addis Ababa are the following languages spoken: Amharic, Tigrigna, Orominga, Guaragigna, Somali, Arabic, English, over 70 others.
In the country Fiji in Oceania/Australia with the Suva are the following languages spoken: English (official), Fijian, Hindustani.
In the country Finland in Europe with the Helsinki are the following languages spoken: Finnish 92%, Swedish 6% (both official); small Sami- (Lapp) and Russian-speaking minorities.
In the country France in Europe with the Paris are the following languages spoken: French 100%, rapidly declining regional dialects (Proven√ßal, Breton, Alsatian, Corsican, Catalan, Basque, Flemish).
In the country Gabon in Africa with the Libreville are the following languages spoken: French (official), Fang, Myene, Nzebi, Bapounou/Eschira, Bandjabi.
In the country Gambia in Africa with the The, Banjul are the following languages spoken: English (official), Mandinka, Wolof, Fula, other indigenous.

In the country Georgia in Asia with the T"bilisi are the following languages spoken: Georgian 71% (official), Russian 9%, Armenian 7%, Azerbaijani 6%, other 7% (Abkhaz is the official language in Abkhazia).
In the country Germany in Europe with the Berlin are the following languages spoken: German.
In the country Ghana in Africa with the Accra are the following languages spoken: English (official), African languages (including Akan, Moshi-Dagomba, Ewe, and Ga).
In the country Greece in Europe with the Athens are the following languages spoken: Greek 99% (official), English, French.
In the country Grenada in North and Central America (Including the Caribbean) with the Saint George"s are the following languages spoken: English (official), French patois.

In the country Guatemala in South America with the Guatemala are the following languages spoken: Spanish 60%, Amerindian languages 40% (23 officially recognized Amerindian languages, including Quiche, Cakchiquel, Kekchi, Mam, Garifuna, and Xinca).
In the country Guinea in Africa with the Conakry are the following languages spoken: French (official), native tongues (Malink√©, Susu, Fulani).
In the country Guinea-Bissau in Africa with the Bissau are the following languages spoken: Portuguese (official), Criolo, African languages.
In the country Guyana in South America with the Georgetown are the following languages spoken: English (official), Amerindian dialects, Creole, Hindi, Urdu.
In the country Haiti in North and Central America (Including the Caribbean) with the Port-au-Prince are the following languages spoken: Creole and French (both official).

In the country Honduras in North and Central America (Including the Caribbean) with the Tegucigalpa are the following languages spoken: Spanish (official), Amerindian dialects; English widely spoken in business.
In the country Hungary in Europe with the Budapest are the following languages spoken: Magyar (Hungarian) 94%, other 6%.
In the country Iceland in Europe with the Reykjavik are the following languages spoken: Icelandic, English, Nordic languages, German widely spoken.

In the country India in Asia with the New Delhi are the following languages spoken: Hindi 30%, English, Bengali, Gujarati, Kashmiri, Malayalam, Marathi, Oriya, Punjabi, Tamil, Telugu, Urdu, Kannada, Assamese, Sanskrit, Sindhi (all official); Hindi/Urdu; 1,600+ dialects.
In the country Indonesia in Asia with the Jakarta are the following languages spoken: Bahasa Indonesia (official), English, Dutch, Javanese, and more than 580 other languages and dialects.

In the country Iran in Asia with the Tehran are the following languages spoken: Persian and Persian dialects 58%, Turkic and Turkic dialects 26%, Kurdish 9%, Luri 2%, Balochi 1%, Arabic 1%, Turkish 1%, other 2%.
In the country Iraq in Asia with the Baghdad are the following languages spoken: Arabic (official), Kurdish (official in Kurdish regions), Assyrian, Armenian.
In the country Ireland in Europe with the Dublin are the following languages spoken: English, Irish (Gaelic) (both official).
In the country Israel in Asia with the Jerusalem are the following languages spoken: Hebrew (official), Arabic, English.
In the country Italy in Europe with the Rome are the following languages spoken: Italian (official); German-, French-, and Slovene-speaking minorities.
In the country Jamaica in North and Central America (Including the Caribbean) with the Kingston are the following languages spoken: English, Jamaican Creole.
In the country Japan in Asia with the Tokyo are the following languages spoken: Japanese.
In the country Jordan in Asia with the Amman are the following languages spoken: Arabic (official), English.
In the country Kazakhstan in Asia with the Astana are the following languages spoken: Kazak (Qazaq, state language) 64%; Russian (official, used in everyday business) 95% (2001 est.).
In the country Kenya in Africa with the Nairobi are the following languages spoken: English (official), Swahili (national), and numerous indigenous languages.
In the country Kiribati in Oceania/Australia with the Tarawa are the following languages spoken: English (official), I-Kiribati (Gilbertese).
In the country Kosovo in Europe with the Pristina are the following languages spoken: Albanian (official), Serbian (official), Bosnian, Turkish, Roma.
In the country Kuwait in Asia with the Kuwait are the following languages spoken: Arabic (official), English.
In the country Kyrgyzstan in Asia with the Bishkek are the following languages spoken: Kyrgyz, Russian (both official).
In the country Laos in Asia with the Vientiane are the following languages spoken: Lao (official), French, English, various ethnic languages.
In the country Latvia in Europe with the Riga are the following languages spoken: Latvian 58% (official), Russian 38%, Lithuanian, other (2000).
In the country Lebanon in Europe with the Beirut are the following languages spoken: Arabic (official), French, English, Armenian.
In the country Lesotho in Africa with the Maseru are the following languages spoken: English, Sesotho (both official); Zulu, Xhosa.
In the country Liberia in Africa with the Monrovia are the following languages spoken: English 20% (official), some 20 ethnic-group languages.
In the country Libya in Africa with the Tripoli are the following languages spoken: Arabic, Italian, and English widely understood in major cities.
In the country Liechtenstein in Europe with the Vaduz are the following languages spoken: German (official), Alemannic dialect.
In the country Lithuania in Europe with the Vilnius are the following languages spoken: Lithuanian 82% (official), Russian 8%, Polish 6% (2001).
In the country Luxembourg in Europe with the Luxembourg are the following languages spoken: Luxermbourgish (national) French, German (both administrative).
In the country Macedonia in Europe with the Skopje are the following languages spoken: Macedonian 67%, Albanian 25% (both official); Turkish 4%, Roma 2%, Serbian 1% (2002).
In the country Madagascar in Africa with the Antananarivo are the following languages spoken: Malagasy and French (both official).

In the country Malawi in Africa with the Lilongwe are the following languages spoken: Chichewa 57.2% (official), Chinyanja 12.8%, Chiyao 10.1%, Chitumbuka 9.5%, Chisena 2.7%, Chilomwe 2.4%, Chitonga 1.7%, other 3.6% (1998).

In the country Malaysia in Asia with the Kuala Lumpur are the following languages spoken: Bahasa Melayu (Malay, official), English, Chinese dialects (Cantonese, Mandarin, Hokkien, Hakka, Hainan, Foochow), Tamil, Telugu, Malayalam, Panjabi, Thai; several indigenous languages (including Iban, Kadazan) in East Malaysia.
In the country Maldives in Asia with the Male are the following languages spoken: Maldivian Dhivehi (official); English spoken by most government officials.
In the country Mali in Africa with the Bamako are the following languages spoken: French (official), Bambara 80%, numerous African languages.
In the country Malta in Europe with the Valletta are the following languages spoken: Maltese and English (both official).

In the country Marshall Islands in Oceania/Australia with the Majuro are the following languages spoken: Marshallese 98% (two major dialects from the Malayo-Polynesian family), English widely spoken as a second language (both official); Japanese.
In the country Mauritania in Africa with the Nouakchott are the following languages spoken: Hassaniya Arabic (official), Pulaar, Soninke, French, Wolof.
In the country Mauritius in Africa with the Port Louis are the following languages spoken: English less than 1% (official), Creole 81%, Bojpoori 12%, French 3% (2000).

In the country Mexico in North and Central America (Including the Caribbean) with the Mexico City are the following languages spoken: Spanish, various Mayan, Nahuatl, and other regional indigenous languages.

In the country Micronesia in Oceania/Australia with the Federated States of, Palikir are the following languages spoken: English (official, common), Chukese, Pohnpeian, Yapase, Kosrean, Ulithian, Woleaian, Nukuoro, Kapingamarangi.
In the country Moldova in Europe with the Chisinau are the following languages spoken: Moldovan (official; virtually the same as Romanian), Russian, Gagauz (a Turkish dialect).
In the country Monaco in Europe with the Monaco are the following languages spoken: French (official), English, Italian, Mon√©gasque.
In the country Mongolia in Asia with the Ulaanbaatar are the following languages spoken: Mongolian, 90%; also Turkic and Russian (1999).
In the country Montenegro in Europe with the Podgorica are the following languages spoken: Serbian/Montenegrin (Ijekavian dialect‚Äîofficial).
In the country Morocco in Africa with the Rabat are the following languages spoken: Arabic (official), Berber dialects, French often used for business, government, and diplomacy.

In the country Mozambique in Africa with the Maputo are the following languages spoken: Portuguese 9% (official; second language of 27%), Emakhuwa 26%, Xichangana 11%, Elomwe 8%, Cisena 7%, Echuwabo 6%, other Mozambican languages 32% (1997).
In the country Myanmar in Asia with the Naypyidaw are the following languages spoken: Burmese, minority languages.

In the country Namibia in Africa with the Windhoek are the following languages spoken: English 7% (official), Afrikaans is common language of most of the population and of about 60% of the white population, German 32%; indigenous languages Oshivambo, Herero, Nama.
In the country Nauru in Oceania/Australia with the Yaren District are the following languages spoken: Nauruan (official), English.

In the country Nepal in Asia with the Kathmandu are the following languages spoken: Nepali 48% (official), Maithali 12%, Bhojpuri 7%, Tharu 6%, Tamang 5%, others. English spoken by many in government and business (2001).
In the country Netherlands in Europe with the Amsterdam are the following languages spoken: Dutch, Frisian (both official).
In the country New Zealand in Oceania/Australia with the Wellington are the following languages spoken: English, Maori (both official).

In the country Nicaragua in North and Central America (Including the Caribbean) with the Managua are the following languages spoken: Spanish 98% (official); English and indigenous languages on Atlantic coast (1995).
In the country Niger in Africa with the Niamey are the following languages spoken: French (official), Hausa, Djerma.
In the country Nigeria in Africa with the Abuja are the following languages spoken: English (official), Hausa, Yoruba, Ibo, Fulani, and more than 200 others.
In the country North Korea in Asia with the Pyongyang are the following languages spoken: Korean.

In the country Norway in Europe with the Oslo are the following languages spoken: Bokmal Norwegian, Nynorsk Norwegian (both official); small Sami- and Finnish-speaking minorities (Sami is official in six municipalities).
In the country Oman in Asia with the Muscat are the following languages spoken: Arabic (official), English, Baluchi, Urdu, Indian dialects.

In the country Pakistan in Asia with the Islamabad are the following languages spoken: Urdu 8%, English (both official); Punjabi 48%, Sindhi 12%, Siraiki (a Punjabi variant) 10%, Pashtu 8%, Balochi 3%, Hindko 2%, Brahui 1%, Burushaski, and others 8%.

In the country Palau in Oceania/Australia with the Koror are the following languages spoken: Palauan 64.7%, English 9.4%, Sonsoralese, Tobi, Angaur (each official on some islands), Filipino 13.5%, Chinese 5.7%, Carolinian 1.5%, Japanese 1.5%, other Asian 2.3%, other languages 1.5% (2000).
In the country Panama in North and Central America (Including the Caribbean) with the Panama City are the following languages spoken: Spanish (official), English 14%, many bilingual.

In the country Papua New Guinea in Asia with the Port Moresby are the following languages spoken: Tok Pisin (Melanesian Pidgin, the lingua franca), Hiri Motu (in Papua region), English 1%‚Äì2%; 715 indigenous languages.
In the country Paraguay in South America with the Asuncion are the following languages spoken: Spanish, Guaran√≠ (both official).
In the country Peru in South America with the Lima are the following languages spoken: Spanish, Qu√©chua (both official); Aymara; many minor Amazonian languages.

In the country Philippines in Asia with the Manila are the following languages spoken: Filipino (based on Tagalog), English (both official); eight major dialects= Tagalog, Cebuano, Ilocano, Hiligaynon or Ilonggo, Bicol, Waray, Pampango, and Pangasinense.
In the country Poland in Europe with the Warsaw are the following languages spoken: Polish 98% (2002).
In the country Portugal in Europe with the Lisbon are the following languages spoken: Portuguese (official), Mirandese (official, but locally used).
In the country Qatar in Asia with the Doha are the following languages spoken: Arabic (official); English a common second language.
In the country Romania in Europe with the Bucharest are the following languages spoken: Romanian (official), Hungarian, German.
In the country Russia in Europe with the Moscow are the following languages spoken: Russian, others.
In the country Rwanda in Africa with the Kigali are the following languages spoken: Kinyarwanda, French, and English (all official); Kiswahili in commercial centers.
In the country Saint Kitts and Nevis in North and Central America (Including the Caribbean) with the Basseterre are the following languages spoken: English.
In the country Saint Lucia in North and Central America (Including the Caribbean) with the Castries are the following languages spoken: English (official), French patois.
In the country Saint Vincent and the Grenadines in North and Central America (Including the Caribbean) with the Kingstown are the following languages spoken: English, French patois.
In the country Samoa in Oceania/Australia with the Apia are the following languages spoken: Samoan, English.
In the country San Marino in Europe with the San Marino are the following languages spoken: Italian.
In the country Sao Tome and Principe in Africa with the Sao Tome are the following languages spoken: Portuguese (official).
In the country Saudi Arabia in Asia with the Riyadh are the following languages spoken: Arabic.
In the country Senegal in Africa with the Dakar are the following languages spoken: French (official); Wolof, Pulaar, Jola, Mandinka.

In the country Serbia in Europe with the Belgrade are the following languages spoken: Serbian (official); Romanian, Hungarian, Slovak, and Croatian (all official in Vojvodina); Albanian (official in Kosovo).
In the country Seychelles in Africa with the Victoria are the following languages spoken: Seselwa Creole 92%, English 5%, French (all official) (2002).
In the country Sierra Leone in Africa with the Freetown are the following languages spoken: English (official), Mende (southern vernacular), Temne (northern vernacular), Krio (lingua franca).

In the country Singapore in Asia with the Singapore are the following languages spoken: Mandarin 35%, English 23%, Malay 14.1%, Hokkien 11.4%, Cantonese 5.7%, Teochew 4.9%, Tamil 3.2%, other Chinese dialects 1.8%, other 0.9% (2000).
In the country Slovakia in Europe with the Bratislava are the following languages spoken: Slovak 84% (official), Hungarian 11%, Roma 2%, Ukrainian 1% (2001).
In the country Slovenia in Europe with the Ljubljana are the following languages spoken: Slovenian 91%, Serbo-Croatian 5% (2002).
In the country Solomon Islands in Oceania/Australia with the Honiara are the following languages spoken: English 1%‚Äì2% (official), Melanesian pidgin (lingua franca), 120 indigenous languages.
In the country Somalia in Africa with the Mogadishu are the following languages spoken: Somali (official), Arabic, English, Italian.

In the country South Africa in Africa with the Pretoria are the following languages spoken: IsiZulu 23.8%, IsiXhosa 17.6%, Afrikaans 13.3%, Sepedi 9.4%, English 8.2%, Setswana 8.2%, Sesotho 7.9%, Xitsonga 4.4%, other 7.2%.
In the country South Korea in Asia with the Seoul are the following languages spoken: Korean, English widely taught.
In the country Spain in Europe with the Madrid are the following languages spoken: Castilian Spanish 74% (official nationwide); Catalan 17%, Galician 7%, Basque 2% (each official regionally).

In the country Sri Lanka in Asia with the Colombo are the following languages spoken: Sinhala 74% (official and national), Tamil 18% (national), other 8%; English is commonly used in government and spoken competently by about 10%.
In the country Sudan in Africa with the Khartoum are the following languages spoken: Arabic (official), Nubian, Ta Bedawie, diverse dialects of Nilotic, Nilo-Hamitic, Sudanic languages, English.
In the country Suriname in South America with the Paramaribo are the following languages spoken: Dutch (official), Surinamese (lingua franca), English widely spoken, Hindustani, Javanese.
In the country Swaziland in Africa with the Mbabane are the following languages spoken: English, siSwati (both official).
In the country Sweden in Europe with the Stockholm are the following languages spoken: Swedish, small Sami- and Finnish-speaking minorities.
In the country Switzerland in Europe with the Bern are the following languages spoken: German 64%, French 20%, Italian 7% (all official); Romansch 0.5% (national).
In the country Syria in Asia with the Damascus are the following languages spoken: Arabic (official); Kurdish, Armenian, Aramaic, Circassian widely understood; French, English somewhat understood.
In the country Taiwan in Asia with the Taipei are the following languages spoken: Chinese (Mandarin, official), Taiwanese (Min), Hakka dialects.
In the country Tajikistan in Asia with the Dushanbe are the following languages spoken: Tajik (official), Russian widely used in government and business.
In the country Tanzania in Africa with the Dar es Salaam are the following languages spoken: Swahili, English (both official); Arabic; many local languages.
In the country Thailand in Asia with the Bangkok are the following languages spoken: Thai (Siamese), English (secondary language of the elite), ethnic and regional dialects.
In the country Togo in Africa with the Lome are the following languages spoken: French (official, commerce); Ew√©, Mina (south); Kaby√©, Dagomba (north); and many dialects.
In the country Tonga in Oceania/Australia with the Nuku"alofa are the following languages spoken: Tongan (an Austronesian language), English.

In the country Trinidad and Tobago in North and Central America (Including the Caribbean) with the Port-of-Spain are the following languages spoken: English (official), Hindi, French, Spanish, Chinese.
In the country Tunisia in Africa with the Tunis are the following languages spoken: Arabic (official, commerce), French (commerce).
In the country Turkey in Europe with the Ankara are the following languages spoken: Turkish (official), Kurdish, Dimli, Azeri, Kabardian.
In the country Turkmenistan in Asia with the Ashgabat are the following languages spoken: Turkmen 72%; Russian 12%; Uzbek 9%, other 7%.
In the country Tuvalu in Oceania/Australia with the Fongafale are the following languages spoken: Tuvaluan, English, Samoan, Kiribati (on the island of Nui).
In the country Uganda in Africa with the Kampala are the following languages spoken: English (official), Ganda or Luganda, other Niger-Congo languages, Nilo-Saharan languages, Swahili, Arabic.
In the country Ukraine in Europe with the Kiev are the following languages spoken: Ukrainian 67%, Russian 24%, Romanian, Polish, Hungarian.
In the country United Arab Emirates in Asia with the Abu Dhabi are the following languages spoken: Arabic (official), Persian, English, Hindi, Urdu.
In the country United Kingdom in Europe with the London are the following languages spoken: English, Welsh, Scots Gaelic.
In the country United States of America in North and Central America (Including the Caribbean) with the Washington are the following languages spoken: English 82%, Spanish 11% (2000).
In the country Uruguay in South America with the Montevideo are the following languages spoken: Spanish, Portunol, or Brazilero.
In the country Uzbekistan in Asia with the Tashkent are the following languages spoken: Uzbek 74.3%, Russian 14.2%, Tajik 4.4%, other 7.1%.

In the country Vanuatu in Oceania/Australia with the Port-Vila are the following languages spoken: Bislama 23% (a Melanesian pidgin English), English 2%, French 1% (all 3 official); more than 100 local languages 73%.
In the country Vatican City in Europe with the Vatican City are the following languages spoken: Italian, Latin, French, various other languages.
In the country Venezuela in South America with the Caracas are the following languages spoken: Spanish (official), numerous indigenous dialects.

In the country Vietnam in Asia with the Hanoi are the following languages spoken: Vietnamese (official); English (increasingly favored as a second language); some French, Chinese, Khmer; mountain area languages (Mon-Khmer and Malayo-Polynesian).
In the country Western Sahara in Africa with the no capital are the following languages spoken: Hassaniya Arabic, Moroccan Arabic.
In the country Yemen in Asia with the Sanaa are the following languages spoken: Arabic.

In the country Zambia in Africa with the Lusaka are the following languages spoken: English (official); major vernaculars= Bemba, Kaonda, Lozi, Lunda, Luvale, Nyanja, Tonga; about 70 other indigenous languages.
In the country Zimbabwe in Africa with the Harare are the following languages spoken: English (official), Shona, Ndebele (Sindebele), numerous minor tribal dialects.
